definition: Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]
Chinese Juniper (Juniperus chinensis)/coffin lid decoration (old)

sentences.english: Qin Hui family was free, Zhao Gou is still doing his emperor.
sentences.chinese: 秦桧一家都被免官，赵构仍在做他的皇帝。

sentences.english: The history of Qin Hui is dead.
Qin Hui critically ill, the emperor personally to visit.
sentences.chinese: 秦桧病危后，高宗曾亲自前往探望。

sentences.english: Qin Hui put all the blame attributed to the "big traitor."
sentences.chinese: 把一切罪过归咎于秦桧这个“大奸臣”。

sentences.english: Qinhui played lots of infamous plots.
sentences.chinese: 秦桧耍过很多臭名昭著的阴谋。

definition: Zhao Gou, personal name of the tenth Song Emperor Gaozong 高宗[Gao1 zong1]
Yue Fei (1103-1142), Song dynasty patriot and general
a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
Wang Qinruo (962-1025), Northern Song dynasty official
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
Wen Tianxiang (1236-1283), Song dynasty politician and poet, folk hero in resisting Mongol invasion in Jiangxi in 1275
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming
Hu Quan (1102-1180), Song Dynasty official and poet
a clique of traitors
Hai Rui (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity
Hairui township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Li Linfu (-752), Tang politician, chancellor under Tang emperor Xuanzong 玄宗
Bao Zheng (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty/modern day metaphor for an honest politician
Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
